idea:
The world is already on fire, but we have to talk about Grok and deepfakes

Elon Musk’s Grok is being used to create non-consensual sexual deepfakes of women in religious clothing. And it is not only being allowed, but promoted. This week’s burning question asks if AI is going to create a world of conspiracy theories and we have a tragic lesson about what happens when you use an AI tool that your platform is trying to sell (and it gets the facts of your story wrong).

Angle: A focus on what Musk is allowed to do (and get away with) despite the grotesque nature of the content being used as a marketing tool for his product.

headline_options: X’s Grok is being used to create non-consensual sexual deepfakes and no one cares
This is the future of AI regulation
The world is on fire, but we have to talk about Grok and deepfakes
How we are regulating AI, but it isn’t working
A platform is using its own AI tool to create deepfakes of women in religious clothing
preview_options: Elon Musk’s Grok is being used to create non-consensual sexual deepfakes of women in religious clothing. And it is not only being allowed, but promoted. This week’s burning question asks if AI is going to create a world of conspiracy theories and we have a tragic lesson about what happens when you use an AI tool that your platform is trying to sell (and it gets the facts of your story wrong).
outline.opening_hook: The defense I have heard for the proliferation of Elon Musk and his X empire is that he is pushing freedom of expression to its limits and we need people like that to test what is possible, but at this point that attitude is warped and naïve. Musk has been transparent about the intent of his “everything app” and it is not to improve or maintain our democracies. This is an app that is actively spreading disinformation and encouraging its users to be as cruel as possible to each other. I have seen the benefits in the world to allowing people to speak their minds, but the power of speech has now been amplified to such an extent that we are not only going to have to accept regulation, but demand it.
